name: HUE White Light
description: TD of a HUE White Light Bulb
markdown:
## Philips HUE Lights

This is a TD of a light bulb that connects to a Philips HUE Bridge.

### Get it running

* Follow the Philips HUE in-app guide to get your bridge started.
* Follow the [developer page](https://developers.meethue.com/develop/get-started-2/) to get an API Key
* The base URI is using our API Key and Light number, replace them with yours:
  * Look for the base URI in the TD
  * Replace the part between `/api/` and `/lights/` with your API key.
  * This TD is representing light number 1. You should replace the part after `/lights/` with your light's number.
  * This TD uses `Philips-hue` as hostname, in case you have multiple HUE Bridges, you will need to change this in the base URI as well

name: EUR-pallet
description: The standard European pallet as specified by the European Pallet Association (EPAL). Pallets conforming to the standardization are eligible for the European Pallet Pool (EPP), the system which allows for an exchange as pallet for pallet .The EUR/EPAL-pallet is 1,200 mm × 800 mm × 144 mm (47.2 in × 31.5 in × 5.7 in); it is a four-way pallet made of wood that is nailed with 78 special nails in a prescribed pattern. The weight of a EUR/EPAL-pallet (EPAL 1) is approx. 25 kg. [1] Around 450-500 million EUR-pallets are in circulation.
markdown: ## EUR-pal.The EUR-pallet, also Euro-pallet or EPAL-pallet, is the standard European pallet as specified by the European Pallet Association (EPAL). Pallets conforming to the standardization are eligible for the European Pallet Pool (EPP), the system which allows for an exchange as pallet for pallet .The EUR/EPAL-pallet is 1,200 mm × 800 mm × 144 mm (47.2 in × 31.5 in × 5.7 in); it is a four-way pallet made of wood that is nailed with 78 special nails in a prescribed pattern. The weight of a EUR/EPAL-pallet (EPAL 1) is approx. 25 kg. [1] Around 450-500 million EUR-pallets are in circulation.

name: HUE Daylight Sensor
description: TD of a HUE Daylight Sensor
markdown:
## Philips HUE Software-based Daylight Sensor

This is a TD of a daylight sensor that runs on a Philips HUE Bridge and that can be used to learn whether there is daylight in the Bridge's location or not. It is based on the GPS location.

### Get it running

* Follow the Philips HUE in-app guide to get your bridge started.
* Follow the [developer page](https://developers.meethue.com/develop/get-started-2/) to get an API Key
* The base URI is using our API Key and Sensor number, replace them with yours:
  * Look for the base URI in the TD
  * Replace the part between `/api/` and `/sensors/` with your API key.
  * This TD is representing the sensor number 1. You should replace the part after `/sensors/` with your sensor's number.
  * This TD uses `Philips-hue` as hostname, in case you have multiple HUE Bridges, you will need to change this in the base URI as well

name: Blynk
description: A hardware-agnostic IoT platform.

name: HUE Dimmer Switch
description: TD of a HUE Dimmer Switch
markdown:
## Philips HUE Dimmer Switch

This is a TD of a dimmer switch that connects to a Philips HUE Bridge and that can be used to turn on and off different HUE Lights.

### Get it running

* Follow the Philips HUE in-app guide to get your bridge started.
* Follow the [developer page](https://developers.meethue.com/develop/get-started-2/) to get an API Key
* The base URI is using our API Key and Sensor number, replace them with yours:
  * Look for the base URI in the TD
  * Replace the part between `/api/` and `/sensors/` with your API key.
  * This TD is representing the sensor number 2. You should replace the part after `/sensors/` with your sensor's number.
  * This TD uses `Philips-hue` as hostname, in case you have multiple HUE Bridges, you will need to change this in the base URI as well

td.title: Hue Dimmer Switch
td.description: A controller to switch off and on all the lights or to dim them

switchInformation.description: Switch information from the bridge with the given id.

state.description: When the switch last pressed and what button was pressed and how it was pressed

buttonevent.description: *2 means short release, * means long release. 1* is the turn on button, 2* is the brighten button, 3* is the dim button, 4* is the turn off button

name: Particle
description: Particle offers an array of IoT essentials—hardware, connectivity, and the platform used to run the connected devices.

name: HUE Bridge Simple
description: TD of a HUE Bridge, configured for lights, dimmer switch and a software-based daylight sensor
markdown:
## Philips HUE Bridge

This bridge has been configured using the white light starter pack that contains 3 white lights and a switch. 

### Get it running

* Follow the Philips HUE in-app guide to get your bridge started.
* Follow the [developer page](https://developers.meethue.com/develop/get-started-2/) to get an API Key
* The base URI is using our API Key, replace it with yours:
  * Look for the base URI in the TD
  * Replace the part after `/api/` with your API key.
  * This TD uses `Philips-hue` as hostname, in case you have multiple HUE Bridges, you will need to change this in the base URI as well

td.title: Hue Bridge
td.description: HTTP to Zigbee bridge that can be used to control Hue lights and read the switch state. The different devices have their own TDs

configuration.title: Configuration Settings
configuration.description: Returns list of all configuration elements in the bridge. Note all times are stored in UTC.

name.description: Name of the bridge. This is also its uPnP name, so will reflect the actual uPnP name after any conflicts have been resolved.

whitelist.description: A list of whitelisted user IDs.

apiversion.description: The version of the hue API in the format <major>.<minor>.<patch>, for example 1.2.1

dhcp.description: Whether the IP address of the bridge is obtained with DHCP.

UTC.description: Current time stored on the bridge.

modelid.description: This parameter uniquely identifies the hardware model of the bridge (BSB001, BSB002).

brigdeid.description: The unique bridge id. This is currently generated from the bridge Ethernet mac address.

all_lights.title: Lights
all_lights.description: Gets a detailed list of all lights that have been discovered by the bridge.

state.description: Details the state of the light, see the state table below for more details.

on.description: On/Off state of the light. On=true, Off=false

alert.description: The alert effect, which is a temporary change to the bulb’s state.'l' of lselect stands for loop.

reachable.description: Indicates if a light can be reached by the bridge

type.description: A fixed name describing the type of light

name.description: A unique, editable name given to the light

modelid.description: The hardware model of the light.

swversion.description: An identifier for the software version running on the light

all_sensors.title: All Sensors
all_sensors.description: Gets a list of all sensors that have been added to the bridge.

get_new_sensors.title: Get New Sensors
get_new_sensors.description: Gets all new sensors since the last scan.

search_new_sensors.title: Search New Sensor
search_new_sensors.description: Starts a search for new sensors.

name: Industrial IoT Long Range Wireless Environmental Temperature Humidity Pressure Air Quality Sensor
description: TM of an NCD Industrial Iot Long Range Wireless Environmental Sensor
markdown:
## Industrial IoT Long Range Wireless Environmental Temperature Humidity Pressure Air Quality Sensor

### Feature Overview

### Industrial Grade Environment IoT Sensor for Monitoring

- Temperature, Pressure, Humidity, Gas Resistance & Indoor Air Quality
- Operating Temperature Range \*40 to +85 °C
- Operating Pressure Range 300 to 1100% hPa
- Operating Humidity Range 0 to 100% r.H.
- Gas Resistance Output in Ohms
- Inbuilt Indoor Air Quality Metric Calculation with a 0\*100 Range
- Configurable Heater Temperature & Duration for Gas Resistance Sampling
- 2 Mile Range with 900MHz On\*Board Antenna
- Superior LOS Range of up to 28 miles with 900MHz High\*Gain Antennas
- Interface to Raspberry Pi, Microsoft Azure, Arduino and More
- Example Software for Visual Studio and LabVIEW
- Wireless Mesh Networking using DigiMesh®
- Power Efficient Built\*in Sleep mode
- Secure Transmission using AES\*128 Encryption
